pages.text: The Alternator converts kinetic energy into electrical energy. The faster the rotation provided to it, the more energy it will generate.$(br)The exact energy formula per tick is y=(x^2)/8 where X is rotations per minute.

However, as with most kinetic machines, the faster it is running, the more stress it generates on the kinetic network. The Alternator's Kinetic Stress Impact is a whopping $(bold)32x$(). A single $(l:kinetic_generators/waterwheel)Water Wheel$() will be maximally stressed by the Alternator. However, it is a good source of entirely-passive electricity generation, espescially when paired with a $(l:kinetic_generators/windmill)Windmill$() or $(l:kinetic_generators/steam_engine)Steam Engine$().
